    • StatementSubmissions

    Cut the Trees

    Time limit: 1000 ms
    Memory limit: 256 MB

    You have NNN trees. For each tree iii you know it's initial height HiH_iH?i?? and it's growth rate GiG_iG?i??. Normally, at the end of day KKK, the height of tree iii will be Hi+(K?1)?GiH_i + (K-1) * G_iH?i??+(K?1)?G?i??.

    But at the end of every day you are allowed to choose any tree and cut it completely. The tree will continue to grow at the same rate during the following days. So, if at the end of day KKK you cut tree iii, then at the end of day K+1K+1K+1 the tree will have height GiG_iG?i??.

    Your goal is to maximize the number of trees that at the end of a day (after eventually cutting one of them) have height at most DDD.

    Standard input

    The first line contains two integers NNN and DDD.

    The second line contains NNN integers representing the values of HHH.

    The third line contains NNN integers representing the values of GGG.

    Standard output

    Print the a single integer, representing the maximum number of trees that can have height at most DDD.

    Constraints and notes

    • 1?N?1051 \leq N \leq 10^51?N?10?5??
    • 1?D?1091 \leq D \leq 10^91?D?10?9??
    • 1?Hi,Gi?1091 \leq H_i, G_i \leq 10^91?H?i??,G?i???10?9??

    InputOutputExplanation
    2 3
4 4
3 3

    2

    The order in which the operations took place is the following:

    cut tree - trees sizes: [0,4][0, 4][0,4]

    check for max - just 1 tree has a hight at most D(3)D(3)D(3)

    trees grow - trees sizes: [3,7][3, 7][3,7]

    cut tree - trees sizes: [3,0][3, 0][3,0]

    check for max - 2 trees has a hight at most D(3)D(3)D(3)

    • At this point, we got all trees to have a hight at most D(3)D(3)D(3)
    5 7
5 8 4 8 1
3 2 5 8 4

    4

    The order in which the operations took place is the following:

    cut tree - trees sizes: [5,0,4,8,1][5, 0, 4, 8, 1][5,0,4,8,1]

    check for max - 4 tree has a hight at most D(7)D(7)D(7)

    • At this point, we have 444 trees that have a hight at most D(7)D(7)D(7)

    trees grow - trees sizes: [8,2,9,16,5][8, 2, 9, 16, 5][8,2,9,16,5]

    cut tree - trees sizes: [0,2,9,16,5][0, 2, 9, 16, 5][0,2,9,16,5]

    check for max - 3 tree has a hight at most D(7)D(7)D(7)

    trees grow - trees sizes: [3,5,14,24,9][3, 5, 14, 24, 9][3,5,14,24,9]

    • This can go on but there's no way to achieve a solution better than 444
    6 8
10 10 7 2 4 1
2 2 2 2 2 2

    6

    The order in which the operations took place is the following:

    cut tree - trees sizes: [0,10,7,2,4,1][0, 10, 7, 2, 4, 1][0,10,7,2,4,1]

    check for max - 5 tree has a hight at most D(8)D(8)D(8)

    trees grow - trees sizes: [2,12,9,4,6,3][2, 12, 9, 4, 6, 3][2,12,9,4,6,3]

    cut tree - trees sizes: [2,0,9,4,6,3][2, 0, 9, 4, 6, 3][2,0,9,4,6,3]

    check for max - 5 tree has a hight at most D(8)D(8)D(8)

    trees grow - trees sizes: [4,2,11,6,8,5][4, 2, 11, 6, 8, 5][4,2,11,6,8,5]

    cut tree - trees sizes:[4,2,0,6,8,5][4, 2, 0, 6, 8, 5][4,2,0,6,8,5]

    • At this point, we got all trees to have a hight at most D(8)D(8)D(8)

    File is too large. Skipping upload.
